bestBHT.bht: In a mocking manner, the crowd sarcastically hailed Jesus with the words, Long live the King! They treated him as if he had just become a king and it was his coronation day, feigning wishes of long life and prosperity. This derisive act belittled Jesus' true kingship and disrespected his rightful authority.

John Gill: In a mock way, wishing him long life and prosperity, as if he was a king just come to his throne, and this was his coronation day.
A king just come to his throne, and this was his coronation day.
Mock way, wishing him long life and prosperity.

bhtAttempts.bht: Mocking Jesus as a king, the people sarcastically hailed him, Long live the King! It was as if he had just ascended the throne, receiving the honor and accolades of a coronation day. In their scornful gesture, they trivialized Jesus' true kingship and scoffed at his authority.

Sarcastically mocking Jesus as a king, the people cynically exclaimed, Long live the King! It was akin to treating his arrival as a regal inauguration, with wishes for his prolonged reign and prosperity. This derisive act trivialized Jesus' legitimate kingship and scorned his rightful authority over all.

Sarcastically mocking Jesus as a king, the people cynically hailed him, Long live the King! It was as if he had just ascended the throne, receiving the honor and accolades of a coronation day. In their scornful gesture, they trivialized Jesus' true kingship and scoffed at his authority.

In a mocking manner, the crowd sarcastically hailed Jesus with the words, Long live the King! They treated him as if he had just become a king and it was his coronation day, feigning wishes of long life and prosperity. This derisive act belittled Jesus' true kingship and disrespected his rightful authority.

Sarcastically ridiculing Jesus, the crowd ironically proclaimed, Long live the King! Their words carried a mocking tone, as if he were a newly enthroned ruler on his coronation day, while insincerely offering wishes for his well-being and success. This disrespectful gesture diminished the truth of Jesus' kingship, undermining his authority and significance.
